availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William P. Carpenter (Jackson County, Kentucky, farm laborer, soldier, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky, farm laborer, soldier, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Farm laborer in Jackson County in 1860. Private and third sergeant in the 47th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment from October 1863 to December 1864. Justice of the peace in Jackson County in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jackson County, McKee, p. 74; Find A Grave, "Sergeant William P Carpenter (1838-1906)," Memorial #41579066, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=41579066&ref=acom (accessed May 2, 2017); Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0440.
